cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move along or just north of eastern-central Cuba today, pass near the Florida Keys on Saturday, then turn northwest and track up the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle or Big Bend coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Southwest Florida coast from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef including Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuban north coast, Bahamas, Florida Keys, Southwest and West Florida coast, Florida Panhandle, northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤10%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; otherwise breezy with gusts 25–35 mph Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated on the Atlantic side of South Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–7 inches possible with locally higher totals leading to urban and poor-drainage flooding in Miami from Friday night through Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf along Atlantic beaches.
